javadoc:
ComponentProviders are required to return Objects of this type in their getActionContext()
 methods.  Generally, ComponentProviders have two ways to use this class.  They can either create
 an ActionContext instance and pass in a contextObject that will be useful to its actions or,
 subclass the ActionContext object to include specific methods to provide the information that
 actions will require.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: provider
params.comment: the ComponentProvider that generated this context.

params.name: contextObject
params.comment:
an optional contextObject that the ComponentProvider can provide
 to the action.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the {@link #ComponentProvider} that generated this ActionContext
@return
methods.name: getComponentProvider
methods.comment: Returns the #ComponentProvider that generated this ActionContext

methods.javadoc:
Returns the object that was included by the ComponentProvider when this context was created.
@return the object that was included by the ComponentProvider when this context was created.
methods.name: getContextObject
methods.comment: Returns the object that was included by the ComponentProvider when this context was created.

return.comment: the object that was included by the ComponentProvider when this context was created.

methods.name: setContextObject
methods.comment:
Sets the context object for this context.  This can be any object of the creator's 
 choosing that can be provided for later retrieval.

params.name: contextObject
params.comment: Sets the context object for this context.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the sourceObject from the actionEvent that triggered this context to be generated.
@return the sourceObject from the actionEvent that triggered this context to be generated.
methods.name: getSourceObject
methods.comment: Returns the sourceObject from the actionEvent that triggered this context to be generated.

return.comment: the sourceObject from the actionEvent that triggered this context to be generated.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the sourceObject for this ActionContext.  This method is used internally by the 
 DockingWindowManager. ComponentProvider and action developers should
 only use this method for testing.
@param sourceObject
methods.name: setSource
methods.comment:
Sets the sourceObject for this ActionContext.  This method is used internally by the 
 DockingWindowManager. ComponentProvider and action developers should
 only use this method for testing.

methods.name: setMouseEvent
methods.comment:
Updates the context's mouse event.  Contexts that are based upon key events will have no 
 mouse event.

params.name: e
params.comment: the event that triggered this context.

methods.name: getMouseEvent
methods.comment:
Returns the context's mouse event.  Contexts that are based upon key events will have no 
 mouse event.

return.comment: the mouse event that triggered this context; null implies a key event-based context

name: ActionContext
comment:
ComponentProviders are required to return Objects of this type in their getActionContext()
 methods.  Generally, ComponentProviders have two ways to use this class.  They can either create
 an ActionContext instance and pass in a contextObject that will be useful to its actions or,
 subclass the ActionContext object to include specific methods to provide the information that
 actions will require.
